00042 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ullmul(const unsigned long m0, 
00043                                               const unsigned long m1)
00044 {
00045     return (unsigned long long) m0 * m1;
00046 }
00047 
00048 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00049                                                const unsigned long uld,
00050                                                unsigned long *const rp)
00051 {
00052     const unsigned long r = ull % uld;
00053     ull /= uld;
00054 
00055     if (rp)
00056         *rp = r;
00057 
00058     return ull;
00059 }
00060 
00061 #define rthal_uldivrem(ull,ul,rp) ((u_long) rthal_ulldiv((ull),(ul),(rp)))
00062 
00063 static inline int rthal_imuldiv (int i, int mult, int div) {
00064 
00065     /* Returns (int)i = (unsigned long long)i*(u_long)(mult)/(u_long)div. */
00066     const unsigned long long ull = rthal_ullmul(i, mult);
00067     return rthal_uldivrem(ull, div, NULL);
00068 }
00069 
00070 static inline __attribute_const__
00071 unsigned long long __rthal_ullimd (const unsigned long long op,
00072                                    const unsigned long m,
00073                                    const unsigned long d)
00074 {
00075         return (op*m)/d;
00076 }
00077 
00078 static inline long long rthal_llimd (long long op,
00079                                      unsigned long m,
00080                                      unsigned long d)
00081 {
00082 
00083     if(op < 0LL)
00084         return -__rthal_ullimd(-op, m, d);
00085     return __rthal_ullimd(op, m, d);
00086 }
00087 
00088 static inline  __attribute_const__ unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long ul) {
00089 
00090     __asm__ ("cntlzd %0, %1" : "=r" (ul) : "r" (ul & (-ul)));
00091     return 63 - ul;
00092 }

00109 static inline unsigned long long rthal_rdtsc (void) {
00110     unsigned long long t;
00111     rthal_read_tsc(t);

00115 #if defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE) && !defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS)
00116 
00117 /* Since real-time interrupt handlers are called on behalf of the
00118    Xenomai domain stack, we cannot infere the "current" Linux task
00119    address using %esp. We must use the suspended Linux domain's stack
00120    pointer instead. */
00121 
00122 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_root_host_task (int cpuid) {
00123     return ((struct thread_info *)(rthal_root_domain->esp[cpuid] & (~(16384-1)UL)))->task;
00124 }
00125 
00126 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_current_host_task (int cpuid)
00127 
00128 {
00129     register unsigned long esp asm ("r1");
00130     
00131     if (esp >= rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 16384)
00132         return rthal_root_host_task(cpuid);
00133 
00134     return current;
00135 }
00136 
00137 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE || CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */
00138 
00139 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_root_host_task (int cpuid) {
00140     return current;
00141 }
00142 
00143 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_current_host_task (int cpuid) {
00144     return current;
00145 }
00146 
00147 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE && !CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */

00149 static inline void rthal_timer_program_shot (unsigned long delay)
00150 {
00151     if(!delay) delay = 1;
00152     set_dec(delay);
00153 }

00164 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00165 
00166 typedef struct rthal_fpenv {
00167     
00168     /* This layout must follow exactely the definition of the FPU
00169        backup area in a PPC thread struct available from
00170        <asm-ppc/processor.h>. Specifically, fpr[] an fpscr words must
00171        be contiguous in memory (see arch/ppc/hal/fpu.S). */
00172 
00173     double fpr[32];
00174     unsigned long fpscr;       /* mffs uses 64-bit (pad in hi/fpscr in lo) */
00175 } rthal_fpenv_t;
00176 
00177 void rthal_init_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);
00178 
00179 void rthal_save_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);
00180 
00181 void rthal_restore_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);
00182 
00183 #ifndef CONFIG_SMP
00184 #define rthal_get_fpu_owner(cur) last_task_used_math
00185 #else /* CONFIG_SMP */
00186 #define rthal_get_fpu_owner(cur) ({                             \
00187     struct task_struct * _cur = (cur);                          \
00188     ((_cur->thread.regs && (_cur->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))   \
00189      ? _cur : NULL);                                            \
00190 })
00191 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00192     
00193 #define rthal_disable_fpu() ({                          \
00194     register unsigned long _msr;                                 \
00195     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mfmsr %0" : "=r"(_msr) );   \
00196     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mtmsrd %0"                   \
00197                            : /* no output */            \
00198                            : "r"(_msr & ~(MSR_FP))      \
00199                            : "memory" );                \
00200 })
00201 
00202 #define rthal_enable_fpu() ({                           \
00203     register unsigned long _msr;                                 \
00204     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mfmsr %0" : "=r"(_msr) );   \
00205     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mtmsrd %0"                   \
00206                            : /* no output */            \
00207                            : "r"(_msr | MSR_FP)         \
00208                            : "memory" );                \
00209 })
00210 
00211 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
